text:
Hi, is there a way to change the ports of wallet-web-ui and ans-web-ui they using port 80 and in some environments it may be restricted because of strict CNI (ex: Cilium with NetworkPolicies enforced)
Currently cant find any way to do so, it would be great to have it configurable.
The `utility-ui` works just fine, default is 8080.

elements.text:
Hi, is there a way to change the ports of wallet-web-ui and ans-web-ui they using port 80 and in some environments it may be restricted because of strict CNI (ex: Cilium with NetworkPolicies enforced)
Currently cant find any way to do so, it would be great to have it configurable.
The
utility-ui
works just fine, default is 8080.

text:
For now ill rebuild the image with slight change in the default.conf inside /etc/nginx/conf.d/default.conf
`listen 80` to `listen 8080`

That should do the trick

to
listen 8080

text:
Cilium is default deny table has 80 for pods looks like, for now i just manipulated the chart splice-validator to have command that will do sed from `listen: 80;` to `listen: 8080;`  and the service target port to be updated, all works now

But its not the proper way to solve it i guess, its more of a small hack to give my team the env ready..
I will say adding a way to change the port is always good option (at least for DevOps handling deployments all day long)

elements.text: Cilium is default deny table has 80 for pods looks like, for now i just manipulated the chart splice-validator to have command that will do sed from
listen: 80;
to
listen: 8080;

and the service target port to be updated, all works now

But its not the proper way to solve it i guess, its more of a small hack to give my team the env ready..
I will say adding a way to change the port is always good option (at least for DevOps handling deployments all day long)
